basics.name: Amy Fan
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: Second Year Master's student studying Statistics and Data Science at the University of Arizona

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Automated Detection of Fluorescent Particles for Counting Cells
projects.summary: Cell imaging is a major field of study in molecular biology research. As a result, many students spend countless hours counting and recording cell activity. This deep learning project tackles this issue by automating the cell counting processing using a Mask R-CNN model architecture.

projects.name: Eye'm Watching You
projects.summary: Are you or someone you know suffering from fine motor control issues? Many take for granted that our computer mouses are controlled by these movements. This project aims to provide an eye tracker that translates pupil movement to mouse movement. This mini-project was launched to tackle this issue at a global MLH hackathon and won best DEI project.
